frame.name: Getting
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Recipient</fen> starts off without the <fen>Theme</fen> in their possession, and then comes to possess it. Although the <fen>Source</fen> from which the <fen>Theme</fen> came is logically necessary, the <fen>Recipient</fen> and its changing relationship to the <fen>Theme</fen> is profiled.
<ex><fex name="Recipient">I</fex> <t>got</t> <fex name="Theme">two whistles</fex> <fex name="Source">from John</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Recipient
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Recipient</fen> indicates the entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Theme
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Theme</fen> is the object that changes possession.</def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Source</fen> is the location that the <fen>Theme</fen> formerly occupied. Persons that begin in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen> may metonymically stand in for the <fen>Source</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> denotes where the Getting takes place.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The purpose for which an intentional act is performed.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> refers to the existing eventuality that the <fen>Recipient</fen> is responding to.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Means</fen> is the action of the <fen>Recipient</fen> which results in their possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the Manner in which an Agent intentionally acts. </def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition:
<def-root>The state that either the <fen>Recipient</fen> or the <fen>Theme</fen> end up in after the acquisition.
<ex>You should <t>acquire</t> it <fex name="Result">without any publicity</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Concessive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause.</def-root>

FE.name: Beneficiary
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Beneficiary</fen> is an entity which the <fen>Recipient</fen> passes the <fen>Theme</fen> to, or shares the <fen>Theme</fen> with.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any condition or situation that serves as a very general background, against which the further importance of the Getting is understood.
<ex><fex name="Circumstances">With him out of the room</fex> , I <t>got</t> all the popcorn .</ex></def-root>
